title: Has there been any war worse than World War 2? - Quora

response.answer_text: That answer largely depends on your point of view. In terms of (absolute) number of casualties or total number of active war participants the answer is clear: No. But e.g. measured by relative casualties (compared to total population) for a single country or by result for the loser, there are certainly cases worse than WW 2. Just 2 examples: The thirty years war in Europe (1618–1648) took a total toll of appr. one third of the whole German population by battle deaths, famine and deseases. The third Punic war between Rome and Carthago (149–146 BC) costed Carthagos existence and led to slavery for all of Carhagos remaining population. Some of Dschinghis Khans or Tamerlans campaigns likewise included destruction of whole cities or principalities including death or/and slavery for their entire populations. Thus in a nutshell - if the whole earth populazion is your reference, WW2 so far was the worst war in mankinds history. If single regions are your reference, than their were wars far worse.

There have been any number of historical wars that featured atrocities on the scale of World War II. There have also been wars that lasted much longer. But, as far as the scope of its size it was probably the largest war in history with large scale sustained military operations taking place over more of the earth’s surface than any war before or since.
No, World War II was definitely the bloodiest, most brutal war in recorded history.

World War 2 probably had the highest death toll of any war in history. There are a few estimates that have put the death toll of the Taiping Rebellion higher though most tend to put it lower. So on that basis I’d say no probably not, not least as World War 2 affected far more areas.

I suppose that would depend on what you mean by “worse.” Many might argue that the Trench warfare of the First World War was worse because of the level of misery and suffering it caused. Others might point to other wars, pseudo-wars and police actions as being worse because of this factor or that factor. However, as far as the scope of the war and the level of destruction it caused, it is the worst in that regard.
The mongol conquests? Although it was a conquest and not a war, still many people died at the hands of the mongol hordes. But not that many wars can say they were worse.

Considering the lives lost, only 2 wars have past WWII. (The Taiping Rebellion from 1850–1864 in Qing China, and the Three Kingdoms War/Period from 184–280 in post-Han Dynasty China) List of wars by death toll - Wikipedia Considering the conflicting ideologies, depends on whether you think that the Cold War was a “war”. Beyond these two points, WWII is the worst war in human history.
Relative to the number of combatants and the scope of the environment, I would suggest the Paraguayan War , the 30 Years War and the Second Punic War as possible comparatives.
